frameDefinitions: A Donor transfers a Theme from a Donor to a Recipient.
This frame concerns people being in an altered mental state that is induced by an Intoxicant.
A Self_mover begins the motion away from a relatively deprofiled Source location.
A Text is an entity that contains linguistic, symbolic information on a Topic, created by an Author at the Time_of_creation.
In this frame, a Communicator judges the Addressee and then communicates that appraisal directly to the Addressee.
This frame concerns rituals performed in line with religious beliefs or tradition.
frameExamples: After a lunch of sandwiches on paper plates, we <t>get</t> <t>under</t> <t>way</t>.
The principal <t>rebuked</t> the student for cheating on the exam.
In certain fertility <t>rites</t> in Burma , a woman desirous of offspring is required not only to approach the King Cobra but to plant a kiss on its mouth .
listRoleDefinitions: The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that changes ownership.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Donor</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The mental state of the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is changed by an <fen>Intoxicant</fen> .
The <fen>Intoxicant</fen> alters the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s mental experience.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> becomes intoxicated.
The <fen>Self_mover</fen> is the volitional agent that moves.
<fen>Source</fen> refers to the starting-point of the <fen>Self_mover</fen>'s motion.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Self_mover</fen> begins the motion away from the <fen>Source</fen>.
The <fen>Text</fen> is the entity that contains linguistic information. This an incorporated role for each LU in this frame.
The region where the <fen>Text</fen> is sold, circulated, or otherwise popular.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates a judgment to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The <fen>Addressee</fen> is jduged by the <fen>Communicator</fen> and receives the message of approval or disapproval.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject on which the <fen>Addressee</fen> is being judged.
The <fen>Reason</fen> is why the Communicator forms the type of judgment they form.
The <fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract entity in which the judgment is conveyed.
An action or entity under the control of the <fen>Communicator</fen> that expresses the criticism or praise directed towards the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> berates or compliments the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> admonishes the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
This is the religious or cultural leader who performs and/or leads the rite.
The role <fen>Member</fen> describes the member of the religious or cultural group who participates in/undergoes the rite.
<fen>Organization</fen> identifies the institution in which the rite is prescribed.
This role identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> used to perform a particular rite.
This role identifies the state which the rite is hoped or intended to bring about.
The type of ritual or ceremony being performed.
This role indicates an object on which a rite is performed.
Rites may confer a <fen>New_status</fen> on a participant (e.g. rank, membership).
The <fen>Guardian</fen> is the member of the <fen>Organization</fen> who instigates the rite for someone of which they are a guardian.
When the rite is performed
Where the rite takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Tom and I</fex> got under way in the wee hours of the morning, planning to get to the confluence area between the onsets of nautical and civil twilight.
The vessel got under way <fex>from San Francisco</fex> on 14 June and completed two round-trips to Manila before the cessation of hostilies.
We got going <fex>at 5 am</fex> in the rain, just to make the massive hike to Davenport Gap.
The teacher scolded the children <fex>about their meessy cookie eating</fex>.
The principal rebuked the student <fex>for cheating on the exam</fex>.
Though she had killed him so long ago, she could still see his jeering <fex>smile</fex>.
She complimented me <fex>almost every morning</fex> on my smart starched shirts.
We were scolded <fex>in the kitchen</fex> by the biggest cook you've ever seen.
His baptism <fex>into the Catholic Church</fex> is scheduled for next Sunday.
Elliott was almost ordained <fex>as a priest</fex>
<fex>Mr. and Mrs. Wilson</fex> baptized their son.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: Mir Seyyed Ali Hamadani Faqih Shafi'i
the end of a fast day
